allies.name: Veterans Organizations (VFW, American Legion)
allies.rationale: Direct benefit: extending military facility air quality standards to veteran housing programs. Natural bridge from military pilot to civilian application.

allies.name: EPA (Environmental Protection Agency)
allies.rationale: Upcoming rulemaking on indoor air quality standards. Military pilot data could inform EPA regulations. Primary regulatory vehicle for scaling.
allies.scaling_relevance: Primary regulatory authority for air quality standards

allies.name: HUD (Department of Housing and Urban Development)
allies.rationale: Interest in evidence-based air quality standards for public housing. Direct scaling path: military facilities â†’ HUD public housing.

allies.name: Health Insurance Industry (AHIP, Blue Cross Blue Shield)
allies.rationale: Respiratory illness claims linked to poor indoor air quality. Preventive policy measures reduce long-term healthcare costs. Economic case for scaling.

allies.name: Public Health Organizations (APHA, CDC)
allies.rationale: Health evidence base for mold exposure and respiratory health. Link military pilot health outcomes to broader public health policy.

allies.name: School Districts & Education Associations
allies.rationale: Inconsistent state/local air quality standards for educational facilities. Gap between military facility standards and civilian school requirements.
allies.scaling_relevance: Scaling opportunity: military facilities â†’ public schools

allies.name: Tenant Advocacy Organizations
allies.rationale: Increased tenant complaints about air quality and mold issues. Demand for standardized monitoring and remediation protocols.

opponents.name: Property Management Associations (NMHC, NAA)
opponents.rationale: Potential cost burden of air quality monitoring and remediation requirements. May oppose mandatory standards without cost-sharing mechanisms.
opponents.scaling_relevance: Primary industry opposition to policy scaling

opponents.name: Real Estate Development Industry
opponents.rationale: Concerns about construction costs and regulatory compliance burden. May oppose federal standards that override state/local flexibility.

opponents.name: State/Local Government Associations
opponents.rationale: Federal preemption concerns. May oppose federal standards that override existing state/local air quality regulations.

neutral.name: State Health Departments
neutral.rationale: Awaiting federal coordination details. May support if federal standards align with state priorities and include state implementation flexibility.

neutral.name: Building Code Organizations (ICC, NFPA)
neutral.rationale: Awaiting technical specifications and evidence base. May support if standards align with existing building code frameworks.

neutral.name: Academic Research Institutions
neutral.rationale: Awaiting peer review of military pilot evidence. May support if evidence is independently verified and published.

unknown.name: Congressional Committees (House Energy & Commerce, Senate HELP)
unknown.rationale: Jurisdiction over EPA/HUD authorizations. Position depends on committee priorities and member interests. Requires further intelligence gathering.

unknown.name: Appropriations Committees
unknown.rationale: Budget implications of policy scaling. Position depends on cost estimates and funding mechanisms. Requires budget analysis.
